intro: Lastreopsis davalliiformis, commonly known as the rock tamarisk, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is typically found growing in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. This species is often used in landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
